Articles.Content: Hello, I'm trying to install my KSP onto my new computer (and yes, I have a legit copy of it) but every time that I click the download button on the KSP store, it gives me the HTTP 403 Forbidden error. I'm running Windows 10 if that could be causing any issues, but I honestly doubt it since it wont even let me download the files. I've tried every download on the page, and its treating me like a spammer, does anyone know how to solve this?

It's working just fine for me. Try using another browser and/or clearing your browser's cache. HTTP 403 means that the server thinks you don't have permission to access the downloads, not that your a spammer, so changing or resetting certain browser information may fix the problem.

Also, moved to the Kerbal Network, where support for KSP websites is handled.

It's working just fine for me. Try using another browser and/or clearing your browser's cache. HTTP 403 means that the server thinks you don't have permission to access the downloads, not that your a spammer, so changing or resetting certain browser information may fix the problem.

Also, moved to the Kerbal Network, where support for KSP websites is handled.

Alright, I just tested this on another computer, and im getting the same error,but I have also noticed that it says I have only paid $20 for my KSP, which I did, but it seems the price has risen to $30, could that in any way effect it?

No, the price changes don't affect your ability to redownload the game.

At this point, your best bet is to e-mail [email protected]. You'll want to include your account ID and proof of purchase (should be an e-mail you received after purchasing). Fair warning, they may not respond until they get back from the weekend.
